title: Neighbor sum distinguishing total coloring of planar graphs without 4-cycles
abstract: Let $$G=(V,E)$$ be a graph and $$\phi : V\cup E\rightarrow \{1,2,\ldots ,k\}$$ be a proper total coloring of G. Let f(v) denote the sum of the color on a vertex v and the colors on all the edges incident with v. The coloring $$\phi $$ is neighbor sum distinguishing if $$f(u)\ne f(v)$$ for each edge $$uv\in E(G)$$ . The smallest integer k in such a coloring of G is the neighbor sum distinguishing total chromatic number of G, denoted by $$\chi _{\Sigma }''(G)$$ . Pilśniak and Woźniak conjectured that $$\chi _{\Sigma }''(G)\le \Delta (G)+3$$ for any simple graph. By using the famous Combinatorial Nullstellensatz, we prove that $$\chi _{\Sigma }''(G)\le \max \{\Delta (G)+2, 10\}$$ for planar graph G without 4-cycles. The bound $$\Delta (G)+2$$ is sharp if $$\Delta (G)\ge 8$$ .
